intro: Chamaecrista elachistophylla, commonly known as narrow-leaved burr legume, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its small, yellow flowers are clustered in racemes, and the leaves are narrow and often hairy. It plays a role in soil stabilization and provides forage for wildlife in its native habitat.
